result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael I Taylor was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 4th Degree Sexual Assault, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.225(3m).
  • Child Abuse-Intentionally Cause Harm, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.03(2)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Pay all court costs and supervision fees.  If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.
Alcohol assessment and follow through with recommendations. No alcohol, random UA's at discretion of agent.
Drug assessment and follow through with recommendations. No controlled substances, random UA's at discretion of agent. Defendant may only take medication pursuant to a prescription.

Counseling, treatment, services as deemed appropriate by agent.   Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law if not previously provided.  Defendant must pay mandatory DNA surcharge.  Firearm warning given.  Voting prohibited until sentence is complete and civil rights have been restored.  Defendant must register with the Sex Offender Registry and comply with all rules and requirements of the Sex Offender Registry. Defendant must obey all rules and regulations of probation.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea
Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

supervisions.notes:
Length of confinement and length of extended supervision for a total length of 54 years bifurcated sentence.
Concurrent with: Count 1.

superMiscConds.notes: No contact with the victim N.F.T. or foster family (person, property, residence or family).  Participate in sex offender treatment.  No contact with Alex Anderson, deric Kolvenback, or Everette Robinson.  No use of internet or social media of any kind unless permitted by DOC Agent.  Do not work with children in any job.  No body armor of any kind.  Counseling, treatment, services as deemed appropriate by agent.  Defendant must obey all rules and regulations of probation.  Firearm warning given.  Ineligible voting notice and acknowledgement.

No contact with the victim (person, property, residence or family) with the exception of deft's parents. If Lifestyle Group home or a similar group home as long as they are willing to abide by conditions of bond.
